protected_spaces_details.description: Outdoor sports facilities incl school playing fields

description:
Variation of conditions 4, 6, 8, 22 and 30 of Full Planning Permission (ref 00703/A/P11) for the demolition of all existing buildings and the erection of a stadium with ancillary accommodation (D2 Use Class), associated infrastructure including a new vehicular and pedestrian bridge from the eastern corner of the site into Capital Interchange Way, reopening of an existing pedestrian underpass from Kew Bridge Station beneath Lionel Road South and the construction of a new covered, open sided link from that underpass to the stadium external concourse, vehicular and pedestrian circulation areas, public realm improvements, 60 car parking spaces, 400 cycle parking spaces and landscaping; and Outline Planning Permission for the demolition of all existing buildings and erection of associated enabling development, comprising up to 910 residential units (C3 Use Class), up to 1,200sqm retail/other floorspace (A1, A2, A3, A4, A5, D1 and D2 Use Classes), a hotel of up to 160 bedrooms (C1 Use Class), vehicular and pedestrian circulation areas, up to 775 car parking spaces, cycle parking, associated hard and soft landscaping and public and private amenity spaces (all matters reserved) to:

"	Change of use of part of west stand at ground and first floor level from community use (D2 use) to hotel (C1 use)
	Increase in the number of hotel (C1 use) bedrooms by 5 bedrooms bringing the total number of bedrooms to 165 
	The expansion of the Block D hotel use (floors 1-9) into the podium upper ground floor
	Removal of the hotel use from condition restricting hours of use 
	Removal of the hotel use from condition restricting hours of delivery
	Submission of material samples of the hotel to six months post commencement of development
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted with full planning permission shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Applications for approval of all reserved matters for the first phase of the outline development hereby permitted shall be made to the Local Planning Authority before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission. 

Thereafter, applications for approval of all subsequent reserved matters relating to all additional phases shall be made to the Local Planning Authority before the expiration of two years from the date of approval of the reserved matters of the preceding phase.  The development of the first phase shall be begun within five years of the date of this permission or before the expiration of two years from the date of approval of the last of the reserved matters to be agreed for that phase, whichever is the later. All further phases shall be commenced within three years of the approval of the last reserved matters consent for that phase.

For the purposes of clarification reserved matters for the first phase of outline development (hotel podium) (and as may be amended  to reserved matters approval pursuant to  this permission) were approved on 8 December 2015 (App Ref 00703/A/P12) and subsequently, reserved matters for the initial phase of the residential development were approved on 21 January 2016 (App 00703/A/P13) .  This permission is issued in the context of these approvals or any subsequent reserved matters for the residential or hotel and/or podium phases and shall be treated as matters approved for the purposes of this permission.

Condition : 3 - Approval in writing by the Local Planning Authority of the details of the layout, scale and appearance of the building(s), the means of access thereto and the landscaping of the site (hereinafter called "the reserved matters") for the remaining phases shall be obtained from the local planning authority in writing before any outline phase of the development is commenced.

The reserved matters for phase 1 shall be carried out and implemented as approved in planning ref 00703/A/P13 and drawing numbers Residential Travel Plan Framework, Internal illuminence Analysis, Planning Statement, L-90-007 Rev. G, L-90-010 Rev. C, L-90-009 Rev. C, L-90-008 Rev. C, A-H-80-001 Rev. F, A-I-70-007 Rev. H, A-I-70-003 Rev. H, A-I-70-002 Rev. A, A-K-70-201 Rev. C, A-K-70-303 Rev. A, A-K-70-302 Rev. A, A-K-70-301 Rev. Condition : 5 - The outline development hereby granted approval and any subsequent reserved matters shall not exceed the maximum parameters with regards to footprint, height, floorspace and volume, as shown on the plans submitted with the application (see attached schedule 1).

Condition : 6 - The total floorspace areas of the uses hereby approved shall be limited to the following: 
"	Stadium (D2 use) including ancillary uses within the stadium building: 36,632sqm gross internal area (excludes canopy area)
Within the stadium the ancillary uses shall not include: (i)	Places of worship, cr?ches or day nurseries greater than 100 sq. metres in floor area (within class D1)
"	Hotel (C1 use): 8,209sqm gross internal area with up to 1,209sqm located within the west stand of the stadium
"	Other uses (non-stadium): 1,200sqm gross internal area 

The other uses (non-stadium) shall be for one or more of the following uses of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, as amended, or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification, with change allowed between these permitted uses for up to ten years following first occupation of any unit:  (ii)	Class A1: all uses (iii)	Class A2: all uses (iv)	Class A3: all uses (v)	Class A4: all uses (vi)	Class A5; all uses (vii)	Class D1: all uses except places of worship. (viii)	Class D2: all uses except cinemas, music and concert halls, dance halls, skating rinks, bingo halls.  In respect of any of the above Class D1 uses hereby approved, notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, as amended, or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification; the use shall not be changed to a place of worship without further approval in writing from the Local Planning Authority.  In respect of the above Class D2 uses hereby approved, notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, as amended, or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification; the use shall not be changed to a cinema, m

Condition : 7 - In respect of the Class D2 use of the stadium hereby approved, notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, as amended, or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification; the staidum bowl (i.e. the pitch and spectator terraced seats) shall not be used for events for the purpose of:

(i)	The playing of competitive professional rugby
(ii)	A standalong musical perfromance utilising the pitch

Condition : 8 - Apart from the stadium and its ancillary uses, the non-residential floor space and uses hereby permitted shall not be open to customers/ members of the public outside the hours of 8:00am to 11:00pm Monday to Saturday and 9:00am to 11:00pm on Sundays and Public Holidays.  The stadium shall not hold major events (football matches) outside the hours of 9:00am to 11:00pm. Ancillary uses within the stadium building shall not be open to customers/ members of the public outside the hours of 8:00am to 1:00am Monday to Saturday and 10:00am to 11:00pm on Sundays, Bank Holidays and Public Holidays, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The above restrictions exclude the Hotel (C1) use class.

Condition : 9 - All dwellings within the outline development hereby approved shall be designed to meet the relevant minimum Baseline Standards and aim to meet 'Good Practice' standards of the Housing Supplementary Planning Guidance 2012 (Mayor of London), and all dwellings shall met the 16 Lifetime Homes Standards.  No more than 10% of the total dwellings within the development shall be single aspect north facing units, and all single aspect north facing units shall be designed to incorporate bay windows as per drawing A1.24 of the Design and Access Statement Addendum 1 received 3 October 2013 or other design features to address the north facing aspect as agreed with the Local Planning Authority.   
A report showing how the dwellings in each phase would meet the relevant Baseline Standards and aiming for Good Practice Standards, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing prior to the commencement of each outline phase. Dwellings shall be completed in accordance with the approved standards and maintained permanently thereafter. 
The residential units for Phase 1 hereby approved in application ref 00703/A/P13 shall be implemented in accordance with the approved plans Residential Travel Plan Framework, Internal illuminence Analysis, Planning Statement, L-90-007 Rev. G, L-90-010 Rev. C, L-90-009 Rev. C, L-90-008 Rev. C, A-H-80-001 Rev. F, A-I-70-007 Rev. H, A-I-70-003 Rev. H, A-I-70-002 Rev. H, Unnumbered Central Southern Quantums, Unnumbered Central Eastern Quantums, Unnumbered Capital Court Quantums, Delivery and Servicing Management Plan, L-90-030 Rev. A, L-90-022 Rev. B, L-90-013 Rev. D, L-90-028 Rev. A, L-90-018 Rev. B, L-90-011 Rev. D, L-90-019 Rev. B, L-90-029 Rev. A, L-90-020 Rev. B, L-90-012 Rev. D, Unnumbered Cycle Parking Numbers 26.06.2015 - Rev Y , Unnumbered Car Parking Numbers 26.06.2015 - Rev Y , Statement of Community Involvement, A-K-70-102 Rev. A, A-K-70-101 Rev. C, A-K-70-202 Rev. A, A-K-70-201 Rev. C, A-K-70-303 Rev. A, A-K-70-302

Condition : 10 - Details of the stadium, landscaping, infrastructure and public realm, and reserved matters, shall be consistent with the approved 'Design Code Revision A', dated 23 September 2013. The details of the street frontage and residential blocks on the Central Southern site for Phase 1 hereby approved in application ref 00703/A/P13 shall be carried out as approved Residential Travel Plan Framework, Internal illuminence Analysis, Planning Statement, L-90-007 Rev. G, L-90-010 Rev. C, L-90-009 Rev. C, L-90-008 Rev. C, A-H-80-001 Rev. F, A-I-70-007 Rev. H, A-I-70-003 Rev. H, A-I-70-002 Rev. H, Unnumbered Central Southern Quantums, Unnumbered Central Eastern Quantums, Unnumbered Capital Court Quantums, Delivery and Servicing Management Plan, L-90-030 Rev. A, L-90-022 Rev. B, L-90-013 Rev. D, L-90-028 Rev. A, L-90-018 Rev. B, L-90-011 Rev. D, L-90-019 Rev. B, L-90-029 Rev. A, L-90-020 Rev. B, L-90-012 Rev. D, Unnumbered Cycle Parking Numbers 26.06.2015 - Rev Y , Unnumbered Car Parking Numbers 26.06.2015 - Rev Y , Statement of Community Involvement, A-K-70-102 Rev. A, A-K-70-101 Rev. C, A-K-70-202 Rev. A, A-K-70-201 Rev. C, A-K-70-303 Rev. A, A-K-70-302 Rev. A, A-K-70-301 Rev. C, Design and Access Statement chapters 1-8 and 10 Received: 29 July 2015 Landscaping Reserved Matters Submission dated July 2015, L-90-007 Rev G, A-02-100 Rev B, A-02-003 Rev E, A-02-002 Rev A, A-02-000 Rev E, L-90-009 Rev C, A-CSS-04-400 Rev C, A-CSS-04-006 Rev A, A-CES-04-005 Rev A, A-CSS-04-005 Rev A, A-CES-04-004 Rev A, A-CES-04-003 Rev A, A-CES-04-002 Rev B, A-CES-04-001 Rev E, A-CCS-04-002 Rev A, A-CSS-04-002 Rev B, A-CCS-04-001 Rev F, A-CSS-04-001 Rev E, A-CSS-04-004 Rev A, A-CSS-04-003 Rev B, A-CCS-04-004 Rev A, A-CCS-04-003 Rev A, A-CSS-03-300 Rev A, A-CES-03-300 Rev A, A-CCS-03-300 Rev C, A-CSS-04-017, A-F-70-303 Rev B, A-H-70-001 Rev G, A-F-70-302 Rev B, A-F-70-206 Rev A, A-E-70-204 Rev A, A-CSS-03-000 Rev T, A-CSS-70-010 Rev M, A-CSS-70-009 Rev M, A-CSS-70-008 Rev M, A-CSS-70-002 Rev P, A-CSS-7

Condition : 11 - Detailed drawings of windows, balconies and privacy screens for all dwellings in each outline phase shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before development commences for each phase and the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with any such approval unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 

The detailed drawings of the windows, balconies and privacy screens for the residential units for Phase 1 hereby approved in application ref 00703/A/P11(9,10,11) shall be carried out as approved on drawing numbers: Email dated 06 January 2016, Sureguard window films specification received: 06 January 2016 
A-02-400, Schedule of information relating to the discharge of conditions received: 31 July 2015

Condition : 12 - Detailed drawings of a re-opened underpass and pedestrian access ramp from Kew Bridge Station to the stadium concourse area shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development. The underpass and ramp shall be constructed in accordance with the approved details and completed prior to the first use of the stadium and maintained in accordance with the details thereafter. Should the phasing require that the permanent ramp and underpass be completed following the first use of the stadium, details of any temporary ramp arrangements for access to the underpass shall be submitted to the Council for approval prior to first use of the stadium. The underpass shall be open to pedestrians, including members of the public, at all times, unless otherwise agreed in the Stadium Management Plan.

Condition : 13 - Detailed drawings of the bridge over the railway lines from Capital Interchange Way shall be submitted for approval in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development. The bridge shall be constructed in accordance with the approved details and completed prior to the first use of the stadium and maintained in accordance with the details thereafter. The bridge shall be open to pedestrians, including members of the public, at all times, unless otherwise agreed in the Stadium Management Plan. Vehicular access shall be restricted to emergency vehicles, authorised stadium employees and visitors, authorised ancillary commercial employees authorised residents and visitors of the Central East residential buildings, and for appropriate servicing only.
Condition : 14 - No demolition of Griffin Park stadium shall commence until the Football Stadium hereby approved achieves Practical Completion to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 15 - No development of each phase shall be carried out as approved shall take place until a detailed scheme of feasible on-site sustainability measures covering:  (a) the sourcing of materials to be used in the construction of and fitting out of the building (involving reuse, recycling and other sustainable sourcing);   (b) certification that all dwellings would achieve a Code for Sustainable Homes Level 4 rating or BREEAM Very Good for the relevant areas of the stadium;  (c) the use of passive ventilation and other passive measures;  (d) reducing carbon emissions from the total energy needs (heating, cooling and power) by 25% from the 2010 Part L Building Regulations Standards for the overall outline phases (including from the on-site generation of renewable energy); (e) details of arrangements to allow future connection to a centralised energy centre either on the site or in the locality (district heating network); (f) details of ecological enhancements including biodiversity and habitat planting, provision of bird boxes, bat roosts; and (g) rainwater harvesting.  has been submitted for each phase and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 

The Block D podium phase as approved under planning ref 00703/A/P12 numbered: Sustainable Procurement received: 06 August 2015. The scheme as approved for each phase shall be implemented prior to occupation of that phase unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and retained and maintained thereafter. 
 (h) Within 3 months of first occupation of the residential elements a Code for Sustainable Homes Final (Post-Construction) Certificate, and BREEAM Post Construction Certificate for the relevant aspects of the stadium, issued by the BRE or equivalent licensing organisation, must be submitted for the stadium or each dwelling in that phase to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that Level 4 or BREEAM Very Good has been achieved. All the measures integrated shall be retained for as lon

Condition : 16 - Full details of the Learning Zone and its operation shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first use of the stadium. It shall be completed and available for use in accordance with the approved details prior to the first use of the stadium and maintained in accordance with the approved details thereafter unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 17 - Full details of the Interim Education Centre and its operation shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first use of the stadium. It shall be completed and available for use in accordance with the approved details prior to the first use of the stadium and maintained in accordance with the approved details thereafter unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 18 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am to 6:00pm on Monday to Friday and 9:00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays, Bank Holidays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 19 - Prior to the commencement of the each phase with the exception of block D podium which shall be carried out as approved in planning ref 00703/A/P12 of the development  a scheme shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, giving details of how the buildings, open spaces and car parking shall address 'Secured by Design'  principles. Each phase of the development shall be carried out in full accordance with the approved details and maintained thereafter. The scheme shall include adequate provision for emergency access to the football pitch and 'real time' travel information for spectators.

Condition : 20 - A Construction Environmental Management Plan for each phase of the development, as in the agreed phasing plan, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the implementation of development. The plan shall identifies all aspects of construction that could have an environmental impact and provide management controls to eliminate and/or minimise those identified impacts, with impacts to be addressed including but not being limited to construction dust and noise and any disturbance to vegetation. The plan shall also include details of the arrangements for the temporary use and/or management (as appropriate) of those parts of the sites awaiting redevelopment. The construction of the proposed development shall then be carried out in accordance with the details set out within the approved Construction Environmental Management Plan.

Condition : 21 - No development of each phase shall commence until a Construction Logistics Plan (CLP) for the relevant phase has been submitted to the Local Planning authority and approved in writing. The CLP should include for the relevant phase:  a) booking systems b) consolidated or re-timed trips c) secure, off-street loading and drop-off facilities d) using operators committed to best practice, demonstrated by membership of TfL's Freight Operator Recognition Scheme (FORS), or similar.

Condition : 22 - Deliveries and servicing of the site shall only take place between the hours of 6:00am and 9:00pm Monday to Saturday and 7:00am to 9:00pm on Sundays, Bank Holidays or Public Holidays, apart from servicing of the stadium on match-days, where deliveries and servicing may occur from 6:00am to 11:00pm. The above restrictions exclude the Hotel (C1) use class.

Condition : 23 - Drainage for the site shall be consistent with the measures outlined in the 'Brentford Community Stadium - Floor Risk Assessment' Revision 3 (UN12473fin-rep-FRA), with the drainage system to be designed to ensure:  (i) The peak discharge rate from site no greater than the greenfield runoff rate to existing drainage infrastructure;  (ii) A surface water drainage network capable of containing (with no flooding) runoff from a 3.3% probability rainfall event, including an additional allowance for climate change; and attenuation capable of containing on-site the runoff from a 1% probability rainfall event, including an additional allowance for climate change. (iii) Provision of appropriate attenuation storage on site, with provision for rainwater harvesting and a Sustainable Urban Drainage System (SUDS).  Details of principles for a site wide drainage strategy to achieve the above criteria shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development, with full details for each phase to be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement for work for that phase.  No discharge of foul or surface water from the site shall be accepted into the public system until the approved drainage works have been completed.

Condition : 24 - "Before the development hereby permitted commences: a.	A contaminated land Phase 1 desk study report shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Should the Phase 1 report recommend that a Phase 2 site investigation is required, then this shall be carried out and submitted to, and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The site shall be investigated by a competent person to identify the extent and nature of contamination. The report should include a tiered risk assessment of the contamination based on the proposed end use of the site.  Additional investigation may be required where it is deemed necessary. b.	If required, a scheme for decontamination of the site shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority, for written approval.  The scheme shall account for any comments made by the Local Planning Authority before the development hereby permitted is first occupied.    During the course of the development: c.	The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if additional contamination is discovered during the course of the development. A competent person shall assess the additional contamination, and shall submit appropriate amendments to the scheme for decontamination in writing to the Local Planning Authority for approval before any work on that aspect of development continues.      Before the development is first brought into use: d.	The agreed scheme for decontamination referred to in clauses b) and c) above, including amendments, shall be fully implemented and a written validation (closure) report submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval.

Condition : 25 - Prior to commencement of development, impact studies of the existing water supply infrastructure shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority (in consultation with Thames Water). The studies should determine the magnitude of any new additional capacity required in the system and a suitable connection point, and where new infrastructure is required this shall be implemented in accordance with approval given in writing, prior to occupation of each phase of the development.

Condition : 26 - The Bird Hazard Management plan hereby approved under planning ref 00703/A/P11(26,27,28) shall be implemented and carried out in accordance with the agreed plan Bird Hazard Management Plan A-02-400 Received: 31 July 2015.

Condition : 27 - A) the development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the submitted and approved WSI under planning ref 00703/A/P11(26,27,28) and drawing numbers: Written Scheme of Investigation for an Archaeological Evaluation (Central Eastern Site) dated 18/05/2015
Written Scheme of Investigation for an Archaeological Evaluation (Stadium Site) dated 18/05/2015
Written Scheme of Investigation for an Archaeological Evaluation and Watching Brief (Capital Court Site) dated 18/05/2015
Written Scheme of Investigation for an Archaeological Evaluation and Watching Brief (Central Southern Site) dated 18/05/2015
Written Scheme of Investigation for an Archaeological Evaluation and Watching Brief (Duffy Site) dated 18/05/2015
Lionel Road South - Existing Stable Block Review April 2015
Written Scheme of Investigation for Standing Building Survey dated 18/06/2019 Received: 31 July 2015. B) If heritage assets of archaeological interest are identified by the evaluation under Part A, then before development commences the applicant (or their heirs and successors in title) shall secured the implementation of a programme of archaeological investigation in accordance with a Written Scheme of Investigation which has been submitted by the applicant and approved by the local planning authority in writing.   	 C) No development or demolition shall take place other that in accordance with the Written Scheme of Investigation approved under Part (B).  D) The development shall not be occupied until the site investigation and post investigation assessment has been completed in accordance with the programme set out in the Written Scheme of Investigation approved under Part (B), and the provision for analysis, publication and dissemination of the results and archive deposition has been secured.

Condition : 28 - The Written Scheme of Investigation shall be carried out as approved under planning ref 00703/A/P11(26,27,28) and drawing numbers: Written Scheme of Investigation for an Archaeological Evaluation (Central Eastern Site) dated 18/05/2015
Written Scheme of Investigation for an Archaeological Evaluation (Stadium Site) dated 18/05/2015
Written Scheme of Investigation for an Archaeological Evaluation and Watching Brief (Capital Court Site) dated 18/05/2015
Written Scheme of Investigation for an Archaeological Evaluation and Watching Brief (Central Southern Site) dated 18/05/2015
Written Scheme of Investigation for an Archaeological Evaluation and Watching Brief (Duffy Site) dated 18/05/2015
Lionel Road South - Existing Stable Block Review April 2015
Written Scheme of Investigation for Standing Building Survey dated 18/06/2019
Received: 31 July 2015

Condition : 29 - No development of the stadium shall take place until samples of all materials to be used for the external surfaces of the stadium, including materials to be re-used from the existing stable block and cobbles on the main site, have been submitted to, and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The stadium shall be built and completed to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority using the approved materials prior to its first use.

Condition : 30 - No development of each agreed outline development phase with the exception of phase 1 (drawing number Design and Access Statement chapters 1-8 and 10 Received: 29 July 2015) and  block D podium (drawing number Brentford Community Stadium Elevation Material Examples Planning B2 2 Rev P1, received: 08 October 2015) which shall be carried out as approved in planning refs 00703/A/P13 and  00703/A/P12 respectively shall take place until samples of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the buildings hereby approved have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details. 
B. 6 months post development of hotel outline phase the material to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the buildings hereby aprpoved have been submitted to an approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 31 - No impact piling shall take place until a piling method statement (detailing the type of piling to be undertaken and the methodology by which such piling will be carried out, including measures to prevent and minimise the potential for damage to subsurface water infrastructure, and the programme for the works) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority in consultation with Thames Water.  Any piling must be undertaken in accordance with the terms of the approved piling method statement.

Condition : 32 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no aerials of satellite dishes shall be erected on any building of the outline development hereby approved without the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 33 - i) Full details of hard and soft landscape works for the areas covered by the full planning permission shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of development on the site. Landscaping shall be completed in accordance with the approved details prior to the first use of the stadium. (ii) Full details of hard and soft landscape works for each phase of the areas covered by the outline planning permission shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of that phase on the site. Landscaping shall be completed in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of each phase. An appropriate area of communal amenity space shall be provided on site, and each dwelling shall have a private balcony that meets the minimum area from the Mayor's SPG for Housing baseline standards for private amenity space per occupant. (iii) The landscape details shall include provision of on-site children's play space for children under five years old and children aged six to eleven years old, in accordance with the standards of the Mayor of London's Shaping Neighbourhoods: Play and Informal Recreation Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG), 2012. The children's play space shall be completed prior to the first occupation of residential units in each phase of the development and shall be permanently maintained thereafter. (iv) For both (i) and (ii) above, hard landscaping details shall include hard surfacing materials, proposed finished levels or contours, means of enclosure and boundary treatments, vehicle and pedestrian access and circulation areas, minor artefacts and structures (e.g. benches, lighting, CCTV, works of art etc.), proposed and existing functional services above and below ground (e.g. drainage, power, communications cables, pipelines etc. indicating lines, manholes, supports etc.), walls, gates, fences and boundary treatments.  (v) All hard lands

Condition : 34 - The plans and particulars submitted in accordance with condition (31) above shall include:  (a) A plan showing the location of, and allocating a reference number to, each existing tree on the site which has a stem with a diameter, measured over the bark at a point 1.5 metres above ground level, exceeding 75mm, showing which trees are to be retained and the crown spread of each retained tree;  (b) Details of the species, diameter (measured in accordance with paragraph (a) above), and the approximate height, and an assessment of the general state of health and stability, of each retained tree and of each tree which is on land adjacent to the site and to which paragraphs (c) and (d) below apply;  (c) Details of any proposed topping or lopping of any retained tree, or of any tree on land adjacent to the site;  (d) Details of any proposed alterations in existing ground levels, and of the position of any proposed excavation, (within the crown spread of any retained tree or of any tree on land adjacent to the site) (within a distance from any retained tree, or any tree on land adjacent to the site, equivalent to half the height of that tree);  (e) Details of the specification and position of fencing (and of any other measures to be taken) for the protection of any retained tree from damage before or during the course of development. In this condition "retained tree" means an existing tree which is to be retained in accordance with the plan referred to in paragraph (a) above.

Condition : 35 - Prior to the commencement of development on any phase an external lighting strategy and details of CCTV for that phase of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Lighting and CCTV for each phase shall be completed in accordance with the approved strategy for each phase prior to occupation of that phase, and shall be maintained in accordance with the approved details permanently thereafter.

Condition : 36 - Prior to the commencement of each phase of the development, details of the arrangements for storage and collection of refuse and recycling for the approved dwellings and uses, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be completed in accordance with the approved details prior to occupation of each phase, and shall be maintained permanently thereafter.

Condition : 37 - Noise emitted from any fixed plant on site shall be at least 10dB lower than the existing background noise level as measured at the nearest noise sensitive location outside the site and the measurement should be made in accordance with BS4142:1997.

Condition : 38 - No residential unit shall be occupied until details of a scheme of mitigation for exposure to poor air quality for each unit to ensure exposure to air pollution does not exceed national air quality objectives, with regards to 'London Council's Air Quality and Planning Guidance', has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and the approved details have been completed.

Condition : 39 - No residential unit shall be occupied until details of a scheme of acoustic insulation for each unit has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and the approved details have been completed, with internal noise levels not to exceed 'reasonable' during daytime and 'good' at night time for all units. The scheme shall take account of any noise from mechanical ventilation necessary for the units.

Condition : 40 - That the association football events using the football pitch hereby approved which are open to the general public shall be limited to the following, unless otherwise agreed in writing:  (a)	Brentford Football Club first team competitive league games in accordance with fixture lists as agreed by the relevant football authorities (e.g Football League);  (b)	Brentford Football Club first team cup games in accordance with fixtures agreed by the relevant football authorities e.g The Football Association; (c)	Brentford Football Club preseason friendlies, reserve, youth and ladies team matches; The screening of Brentford Football Club's first team  away Association Football matches; (d)	Three international matches plus pre match training sessions per annum; and (e)	Two charity matches per annum.  No other football code shall be permitted to be played at the stadium.

Condition : 41 - a) No development shall commence until a report that details arrangements for accessibility to the Football Stadium, covering matters detailed in the 'Stadium Access Report' (REPORT-B12 8) dated 13/9/13 has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The details of staidum access for the block D podium shall be carried out as approved in planning ref 00703/A/P12 and drawing numbers Stadium Access Report-B12 8 P7 Received: 06 August 2015

b) No development of any outline phase shall commence until details of arrangements accessibility for disabled people to the buildings and facilities for that phase has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 42 - a) Prior to occupation of the Stadium, details of arrangements for and management of coach parking, and taxi pick up and drop areas for the Football Stadium have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  b) No development of any outline phase shall commence until details of arrangements for taxi pick up and drop areas for that phase, including any coach parking necessary for the hotel, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 43 - a) Details of the location and type of cycle parking for the stadium shalled be provided in accordance with the drawings approved under planning ref 00703/A/P11(43a) numbered: FalcoLevel(-PRO) product specification brochure, AL-90-002 Rev P1 Received 18/01/16

Cycle parking shall be provided in accordance with the approved details prior to the first use of the stadium, with these facilities to be permanently maintained thereafter and available free for members of the public to use outside match times.  b) No development of any outline phase shall commence until details of cycle parking in accordance with London Plan cycle parking standards for that phase has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 44 - No development shall commence until details of anti-terrorism measures for the stadium building and access thereto have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Approved measures shall be implemented prior to the first use of the stadium and maintained permanently thereafter.

Condition : 45 - Full details, including noise levels of any visual display, Public Address (PA), or amplified sound system for the stadium shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first use of the stadium. The approved PA system shall only be used during events that take place within the Stadium two hours prior to the event commencing (apart from for testing purposes) and within 30 minutes of the completion of the event. No PA system, other than for transmission of travel information or emergency use shall take place outside the stadium building. The PA system shall be operated in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 46 - Details of any floodlighting to the stadium shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the stadium is first used.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details. The approved floodlighting shall not be used before 8:00am or after 11:00pm on any day.

Condition : 47 - No development which affects the public highways shall commence until the local authority (as the Highway Authority) has approved in writing full details of works affecting the public highway including:  i) Construction of the proposed buildings inclusive any basement levels, covering structural works and support for adjoining land ii) New pavement surfacing iii) Any proposed street tree planting iv) Maintenance of pedestrian access on the footpaths past the site during construction. The approved works shall be completed in accordance with the local planning authority's written approval and have been certified in writing as complete on behalf of the local planning authority prior to occupation of any part of the development.
